headline: Mom's Zucchini Bread
description: This zucchini bread is flavored with cinnamon and vanilla, with crunchy walnuts in every bite. It is easy to bake, super moist, and delicious.

video.description: See how to make this sensational five-star quick bread.
video.name: Mom's Zucchini Bread

name: Mom's Zucchini Bread

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Grease and flour two 8x4-inch pans.
Sift flour, salt, baking powder, baking soda, and cinnamon together in a large bowl.

Beat eggs, oil, sugar, and vanilla together in a separate large bowl with an electric mixer until combined; add flour mixture and beat well. Stir in zucchini and walnuts until well combined. Pour batter into the prepared pans.

Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, about 40 to 60 minutes. Cool in the pans on a wire rack for 20 minutes. Run a table knife around the edges to loosen. Invert carefully onto a wire rack and let cool completely.

review.reviewBody: I love this recipe! I've made it as is, and it was great. I've also tried it with a few modifications: I was trying to cut down on fats so I replaced the eggs with nonfat Greek yogurt and instead of oil, I used applesauce (the no added sugar kind). I've also used pumpkin puree instead of oil in this recipe and both worked well. ***A HUGE TIP: Whenever I make a bread like this, whether it's zucchini, pumpkin, or banana, I always let it cool for a few minutes and flip it upside down on a plate (while still in the hot pan) and let it cool that way (with the pan still on it). It traps in steam and gets crazy moist (we all hate that word, but I don't know what other way to describe it.) Someone told me that's how Bob Evans makes their banana bread, and it's probably not true, but it does make a huge difference.
Love it. So easy to make and super moist and delicious. Make it every year at zucchini season. Great as muffins too, just cut baking time to 25-30mins.

Great recipe. I always try to add a personal touch in my bakingy. It would be difficult to personalize if there wasnâ€™t a solid recipe-to work from I used a little more zucchini ( about. 1/4 c) and put in extra walnuts ( a little over 1/4 c). I also added 1 1/2 c of currants. I like having a bit more texture in zucchini bread.

Made this today as written and it is moist and very tasty. My husband loved it. Will definitely be making this again and again. Thank you for such a good recipe! The only thing I did different was put it all in my stand mixer and mixed it all on low.
Awesome. I did add carrots, raisins and more cinnamon to the batter. Homerun

I used to make this regularly when all the kids and hubby were here (kids on their own now and hubby passed several years ago). But I had a craving for it, so dug out the recipe along with the modifications I always used. I put in 1 c white sugar, 1 c light brown sugar, 1/2 cup Walnut oil and 1 small 'snack pack type' cup of applesauce. Also ground up some walnuts so had the flavor of the nuts but not the 'chunks' of nuts. Used 2 aluminum foil 4 x 8 pans and bake time approx. 80 minutes at 325 degree oven. Absolutely perfect.
I love it. I only use 1 cup of sugar and I like to use blueberries for a change. I've also used olive oil for a diff taste. Also good
I also added 1 cup of raisins. Delicious!!!
very sweet, like a cake
Made it just like the recipe said Was delicious!
Everyone who tasted it really loved it and wanted the recipe. Think I added some fresh pineapple and less sugar.
The only changes I made (I hate it when people make changes) is to reduce the sugar to 2 cups and add 2 tsp nutmeg. Delicious!

I've made this many times over the years and each time it's a huge hit. It is moist and flavorful and easy to make. It is important to add the liquid from the shredded zucchini or the mix will be much too thick. I pack the 2 cups of zucchini into the measuring cup firmly and that makes it come out just right. Hands down the best zucchini bread I've ever had. Admittedly there is a lot of sugar in it but it's SO good.
Great!

Delicious and always a hit! For my own health, I have made a few changes. I cut the sugar back to about 1 3/4 and it is still delicious. I also ran out of sugar this last time and used real maple syrup and it was great! Lastly, I used almond or walnut oil in place of vegetable oil and it is so good.

I've been making this recipe for years, and my friends and family quite literally fight over it at gatherings. For me, I have made two slight tweaks (I hate when people do that) that have proved extremely helpful and maintain the recipes integrity. 1) I use half white sugar and half brown and it takes a slight edge off the sweetness. 2] 325 doesn't seem to do the job quite right so I do 340 for 15 minutes and then reduce to 325 for the rest of the time. It often takes longer than 40 minutes though so definitely check the center with a wooden toothpick. And to the other comments, 10000% do NOT drain the zucchini!
Mine turned out way too moist, it never rose much either.
I omitted the nuts, but I used the recipe as is otherwise.

Iâ€™ve been making this particular Zucchini Bread for many years. Perfected the recipe for my oven temp and time. The reason why some say this bread seems dry is because you cannot drain the zucchini juice. After grating, pour the juice into the wet mixture. There have been times I added about an 1/8 - I never measure, but Iâ€™ve used pineapple juice along with the zucchini juice when I happen to be making something with pineapple at the same time. I also have used half and half seasonings meaning Cinnamon and Allspice, or adding a little this and that of Nutmeg, Pumpkin spice, Cinnamon. Itâ€™s all so yummy!
I prefer my zucchini bread to be sweeter, but this was pretty good. Very easy to make.

My favorite and even the extended family love it. Not a great change to the recipe, but I did reduce the sugar a bit and add slightly more zucchini as I just wanted to use up what ever was remaining. Turns out delightful every time.

Overall, the zucchini bread has great flavor. It is moist, delicious, and filling. My only complaint is that this recipe is very sweet. I planned on topping my zucchini bread with cream cheese frosting without realizing how sweet the bread already was. If you are looking for a good, sweet, zucchini bread this is the recipe for you!
I actually use 2 teaspoons of baking powder and no Soda I love it.
So simple so moist and very yummy!!!
I love this recipe! Has anyone used it for banana bread?
Thanks for the great recipe. It's the only one I use except I make muffins instead of bread.
I cut the sugar to 1-1/2 cups (still was sweet enough), and added 1/2 cup of raisins, a 1/4 tsp each of mace and allspice. Outrageous!

Iâ€™ve made this recipe several times and itâ€™s always a crowd pleaser! Iâ€™ve made it to it with almond flour and stevia to make it keto friendly too! Thank you so much for sharing this recipe is AWESOME!!

Very good. We used 1c. White Sugar and 1 & 1/4 packed light brown sugar. It was a bit too sweet. We substituted 1 c. Unsweetened applesauce for oil or butter. Also we used our Salad Shooter Pro to shred the zucchini as well as finely chop half of the chopped walnuts. If you donâ€™t have a Salad Shooter, I urge you to scout the thrift stores. Itâ€™s such an easy tool to use and clean up. Since we couldnâ€™t find the bread pans, we made 24 muffins. Calculated at 175 calories per muffin.

I've had zucchini bread before - but never made it. I did it just like the recipe, except the nuts. Although, it had more oil & sugar than I normally use - I wanted something more old-fashioned. This was it! Melt-in-your-mouth perfection. It's so smooth - with a touch of crunch on the crust. I planned to make 1/2 a recipe because I only had one large zucchini. I suggest grating your zucchini first to know how much you can make. I made 2 loaves. It was like putting thick soup in the oven - but it came out beautifully.
I will add more cinnamon and walnuts next time. But it turned out great!
I added honey roasted pecans and dried blueberries to half..

I love this recipe and my husband as well although I cut down on the sugar and used half wheat flour and added all spice and extra cinnamon and of course some chocolate chips along with extra walnuts, zucchini and raisins the outcome was a delicious homemade loaded breadðŸ¥°ðŸ¥°ðŸ¥°

First timer here! I doubled the recipe and followed a suggestion of using a bit less sugar, I used 2 cups sugar per batter. I thought it was getting too thick so I added 1 egg per batter. It came out beautiful and oh so good! Thank you!!!
I kept screwing up but it came out crunchy & delicious

Find another recipe! This needs more cinnamon and probably a little nutmeg. Donâ€™t squeeze the zucchini, it needs moisture. You do have to bake it longer in a loaf pan. I didnâ€™t like the taste at all, this recipe is not good.
I used only 1.5 cups of sugar, and it turn out perfect. Instead of walnuts I sprinkled chocolate chips on top.

I make mine minus the walnuts. For some dumb reason I got family who don't like walnuts; I will say this is the sugariest bread I've ever had. I bet if you cut a cup out of sugar all would be good. I also make mine in the tiny pans to give out to ppl who like zucchini. But I do strongly suggest cut back on the sugar.

This was my first time making zucchini bread so I ended up making a few happy mistakes. I didnâ€™t realize I wasnâ€™t supposed to peel the zucchini before grating itâ€”it made for a much lighter-colored bread. I used butter instead of oil, half raw sugar/half light brown sugar, a tablespoon each of cinnamon and nutmeg, and subbed semisweet chocolate chips for the walnuts. I had to cook it at least 15 more minutes, but it was so good it disappeared overnight. I only had one loaf pan so I put half the batter in the refrigerator overnight and made it the next day after the first batch disappeared. Just as good!
I love this and have made it numberous times I do Cut sugar back to 2 cups perfect!!!
Very good. Taste like grandmas.
I shouldâ€™ve listened to the other 1 star reviews. So sweet and went way over cook time. Not good at all donâ€™t make.

As to the review with the one star review - I know exactly what they did because we did the same thing.... after 40 minutes of cooking my toothpick was still very very wet so we threw it in for another 15... still raw.... so I went back to the recipe and realized it calls for TWO bread pans - wish this was made more clear (I did not watch the video I just went to the recipe) as I completely missed it and now I'm not sure if our bread will turn out (still in the oven currently). I'm really hoping this mistake doesn't cost us all our ingredients and our garden home grown zucchini. USE TWO PANS or just a bigger square brownie pan. The ONLY place besides the video that says to use TWO bread pans is right at the beginning of the recipe. Please make more clear for others!
Why is everyone lying about the zucchini bread. It was awful. The bread was still wet in the middle. I had to cook it longer. To much sugar. I can't make it again.
Great starter zucchini bread recipe. There are many alterations available, but my family enjoys it just as is. Make sure not to drain the grated zucchini.
I made this recipe twice. Once exactly following the recipe and once with some modifications as suggested by others. Delicious both times! Modifications: half applesauce/half Oil. 1 tbsp cinnamon
The only change I made was to use 1 cup each of brown and white sugar.
Iâ€™ve made this several times, never fails. Always moist and delicious.
This is by far the best bikini bread recipe I have ever used. We gave it a 5 star- comes out of the oven and the whole loaf is finished being in 10 minutes. Yummy!
Too oily and too sweet. Unfortunately may toss this. Done a lot of baking this just wasnâ€™t a win here.

I'm willing to give a good review and share my experience, even if the recipe would not have worked out as written. I would say this wouldn't be a good recipe for someone without baking experience. When I was finished adding all the ingredients, the batter was way too cookie dough texture. I added 1/3 more eggs and oil and pureed some extra zucchini to add moisture. It was still not nearly as wet as the video. Also, it did take about 70-75 minutes (I did 6 loaves and some were ready after 70 minutes, the rest at 75). The final result is very tasty with a great texture. A neighbor gave me some zucchini, and now I have some loaves to give away. Thanks for the recipe. Also, at a teacher's breakfast yesterday, they served zucchini bread french toast! It was really good and I'm excited to try that. I wish my kids were as excited about it as I am. : )

This recipe works very well for me, but there is a but. There are substitutions that I make. I use ONE cup of brown sugar, one TEASPOON of cinnamon powder, and just a dash of vanilla essence. Oh, and I add a quick grate of fresh nutmeg(too much and it and the cinnamon and it becomes a spice cake).
Delcious - as muffins. Substituted pecans for walnuts. Used thawed frozen zucchini, undrained. Baked for 25 minutes @ 350. Perfect! Added treat: cream cheese icing. Definitely a KEEPER!

This is by far the worst zucchini bread recipe. I'm not sure how it's well rated by anyone. We followed the recipe to a T (and we are very experienced bakers), and we had to throw this out. Even my kids wouldn't eat it. We couldn't even get the sugar to dissolve completely. It is WAY too sweet and very greasy. It also doesn't have any flavor, other than sweet.

Followed the recipe EXCEPT used unsweetened applesauce for half of the oil and 1 cup of brown sugar and the other cup granulated sugar. Oh, also used 3 cups of lightly packed zucchini. Added toasted chopped walnuts to one loaf and chocolate chips to the other. Scrumptious! Crispy on top, moist and tender on the inside.
It is very good going to make more
I loved it!
Excellent!
This is my go to for making zuccini bread. I did make it a couple of time with brown sugar, when I was low on white sugar. Everyone loved it.
I thought it was way too many ingredients but I did all the ingredients and I made them into muffins

Correct temperature??? The recipe states to bake at 325 for 40 to 60 minutes. Soâ€¦.I baked it for 40 minutes and then continued for the additional 20 minutes as it was no way near done. After 60 minutes, still not done in middle so I added 10 more minutes. Still not doneâ€¦ so added 5 more minutes. Baked for 75 minutes in total. Maybe the bake temperature should be 350, not the 325 as listed. Andâ€¦ I added both nuts and raisins as thatâ€™s what we like. Otherwise, no changes. End result - very tasty!

Didn't have two bread pans so used a 13x9" pan, didn't have cinnamon so i replaced with nutmeg, both worked good. I used my chicken's eggs - from bantam (mini chickens) so I doubled the amt of eggs since their eggs are smaller. And a fresh zucchini from my friend's garden. I did not drain the zucchini and packed it firmly in the cup, I hand mixed with a whisk. It turned out wonderful - moist and great flavor.
It was easy and delicious.

After 40 minutes, I had to turn up the temperature to 350 and cook for 30 minutes. It was not done. I put foil on top of it for 20 more minutes, so that the middle would cook. The reviews alerted me that the inside would not cook, so luckily I had the wisdom of my grandmother with me. It is now 1 am, so I will let you know about the taste. But for effort, it is a low score

I'd give it a zero if I could. The batter was way too dry, the length of bake has so far been off, now cooking for closer to 75 mins minimum so far while it is still just batter and only the outside is somewhat cooked.
Delicious! I throw in more nuts, cause I love them. Tried pecans too, both walnuts and pecans work well.
No it was really good!

I did half oil with half applesauce and added nutmeg, cardamom, cloves, and allspice as well as cinnamon, but otherwise followed the recipe. I had to add some extra moisture (more applesauce), because it was so thick. Turned out good.
Oh my goodness I thought I was foing to give away the second loaf instead my husband and I wilk probably eat both! Sooo goood!

Why are there so many good reviews?? This I the worst zucchini bread Iâ€™ve ever made. Super plain, too much sugar, weird consistency, dry. However if you want to add chocolate chips and bake them as cookies they turn out great.
My first zucchini bread and it was a success. 3 changes: 1) chocolate chips; 2) coconut oil and; 3) sprouted whole wheat flour used. My family liked it. Easy to understand recipe.
I only did 2 cups of sugar and added cocoa power in its place. I also added another egg and drained the zucchini, Sooo good!

I have been making this recipe for years. Edit I decrease the oil by half and add a 1/2 cup of Apple sauce. I also add 2 smallboxes of raisins.. It always turns out wonderful moist and my children and grandchildren eat it up as fast as I can make it.
The ratios are completely off on this recipe. 3 cups of flour to three eggs and 1 cup of oil does not cut it by any stretch. Made it twice and still did not come out right and I bake quite a bit.
Love this recipe, great flavor, and easy to make
Perfect!!!
This recipe is my absolute favorite zuc bread!!! It is so moist and flavorful.

I have to admit that I did make some changes. Definitely 5-stars with the changes. Would have been short loaves and not as moist without altering the recipe. I used 4 cups (packed) shredded zucchini instead of 2 cups. Put half of the batter into one of the 8x4 loaf pans. Mixed a huge handful of chocolate chips (about 1/2 C?) and a handful of raisins (1/3 C?) into the remaining batter. (Hubby cannot digest nuts or would have done the walnuts...I love walnuts.) With the additional zucchini, it needed to be baked for about 1 hour 10 minutes. I test for temp. 200F to 205F for quick breads and cakes (seems to work better for me than testing for crumb.)
Absolutely delicious. I added a heaping tbl. of cinnamon which I love! I Have made it many times and gave as gifts!
I love this recipe!! Instead of 2 & 1/4C of sugar, I added 2 & 1/2C to make it more of a cake instead of a bread. My family absolutely loves it. I've made it 3 times now!!
Easy, delicious
It was so moist and wonderful! Use the juice from the zucchini. I added chocolate chips and it went together so wonderfully.
turned out great, used whole wheat flour so takes less baking time. will make again for sure.
Iâ€™ve never been a big fan of zucchini bread, but this recipe is amazing!
Perfect!
This was a great recipe. We are not a nut in bread family so I put raisins in instead, Was wonderful .
Amazing, I didnâ€™t have a bread pan so I made it in a 9x13 pan. Turned out amazing!

Delicious, nutritious, and stays delicious a long time. Frozen wild blueberries, dried cherries, and chopped walnuts add good variety. The cherries should be cut into smaller pieces, not dropped into the batter whole. From experience, whole cherries mixed into the batter sink and stick to the bottom of the pan when the cooking is done.
Good

Just like the zucchini bread my mom made when I was a child. I had the recipe but misplaced it. So I used this one. Its an excellent recipe. Very moist & delicious! I have tried the orange zucchini bread & it was also delicious. I have a friend who made the chocolate & her family likes it.
This is the best Zucchini bread I have ever made! It is so easy to make and moist and delicious! I have already made 8 loaves in 2 months! Everyone loves it. GREAT RECIPE!!

I don't understand why this recipe has so many 5 stars. The cooking time is WAY off, if at 325 it will take double the time at least. It's very bland, just sugary. And every time I made it, the batter overflows and spills out of the pan. It's a good start, but I recommend adding more spices, bigger pans, and baking at 375 degrees.

Can't tell you have many times I've made this in the last month with zucchini from our garden. But one BIG suggestion is to double the amount of zucchini if you like a moist cake. I also throw on a vanilla glaze (powdered sugar, heavy cream and vanilla) to make it more decadent. Excellent recipe.

This recipe is a good place to start -- which is honestly what I think all recipes are (starting places). As printed it is bland and too sweet -- but it gives basic mesurements to start. After the first batch I, Like another reviewer, I changed to brown sugar. Next, I doubled the zuchinni, doubled the cinnamon -- added nutmeg and cloves. Made it much better! I agree you can't "review" a recipe unless you make it as written -- but once you see what is "wrong" it is nice to share.

Very sweet. I added about 1/2 a cup less of sugar than what it calls for, because almost equal parts sugar and flour seemed like a lot to me, and itâ€™s still very sweet. The texture and taste are good, I just think it needs significantly less sugar.
This is insanely amazing. I used splenda to cut down on calories. It worked out fine. I added craisins and it was a nice touch. Pecans work as well as walnuts.
I left out the nuts, me I love them, however, I do not of the people I'm making it for have my allergies. One I left plain the other drizzled a chocolate pattern on the other.
Amaziing!!!!
I substituted half with whole wheat flour. It was fantastic!
